For media inquiries, please connect with
our media coordinator.

ABOUT
Bhisma
2025-02-04T09:23:58-05:00
FESTIVAL ORIGINS
Festival of Chariots, traditionally known as Rathayatra (chariot procession), is an ancient tradition originating in Jagannath Puri, India.
This festival draws millions of sincere pilgrims to the small beach town, Jagannath Puri in Western India, where the sacred worship is brought to the public streets. Every year three 45-foot tall carts are lovingly crafted and prepared for the celebration. Their Lordships Jagannath, Baladeva and Subhadra are paraded on grand chariots through the streets to bestow divine blessings upon everyone.
Three Rathayatra carts with worshippers massed in the courtyard outside the Jagannath Temple in Jagannath, Puri, Orissa, India
His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada brought Rathayatra (Festival of Chariots) to the United States.
His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness (ISKCON) and his followers held the first Ratha Yatra festival in the United States in San Francisco on July 9, 1967 to celebrate bhakti yoga and share India’s rich spiritual heritage. Today, we bring this vibrant chariot festival tradition from Jagannath Puri, India, to cities across Florida, sharing the same spirit of devotion and cultural richness with local communities.
Festival of Chariots has hosted
more than 100 celebrations
in 20+ years.
OUR STORY
Founded in 2002 in Alachua, Florida, the Festival of Chariots Foundation is a nonprofit that has hosted chariot festivals across the state, uniting thousands in a celebration of devotion, music, and community. While we focus on Florida, similar festivals occur worldwide. Our free, uplifting events invite everyone to experience the rich culture of India through live mantra music, a grand chariot procession, traditional dance, captivating performances, and a delicious vegetarian feast. Attendees can also explore educational exhibits and vendor booths at select events. We’d love for you to join us!
Founded 2002
and sharing joy every since
Florida Festival Locations
Our festival has been held in various cities across Florida:
Jacksonville Beach
St. Augustine
Tampa
Clearwater Beach
Orlando
University of Central Florida (UCF)
Parade Participation
We have taken part in major parades across the state:
Tallahassee Springs Parade
Gasparilla Parade (Tampa)
University of Florida homecoming parade
International Festivals
We have hosted festivals beyond Florida, including:
San Juan, Puerto Rico
Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
Santiago, Dominican Republic
Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic
Holiday & Seasonal Parades
We have participated in seasonal parades, including:
St. Augustine Christmas Parade
Jacksonville Beach Opening Parade
Alachua Christmas Parade
High Springs Christmas Parade
UPCOMING EVENTS

Events Calendar
Bhisma
2025-02-04T09:48:01-05:00
FESTIVAL OF
CHARIOTS
EVENTS
CALENDAR
Our Festival of Chariots team can be found happily singing and dances on beaches, in parades, and university campuses across Florida. Follow us on Facebook for updates and explore our event listings below!
FOLLOR US ON FACEBOOK
FESTIVAL OF
CHARIOTS
2025 EVENTS
MARCH 9, 2025 – Alachua Snana Yatra
“Snana Yatra” literally means “bathing festival” in Sanskrit. At this festival, the deities of Lord Jagannath, Balabhadra, and Subhadra are ceremonially bathed.
4:15 pm Arati and kirtan
5:00 pm Special class on Rathayatra
5:15 pm to 6:30 PM Prasadam feast served
6:00 pm Bathing of Lord Jagannath, Baladev, and Subhadra
Location: Alachua Hare Krishna Temple
17306 NW 112th Blvd. Alachua, FL, 32615
MARCH 15, 2025 – Daytona Beach Festival of Chariots
A day of cultural family fun at Daytona Beach!
Live Music
Chariot Procession
Traditional Indian Dance
Mantra Meditation
Free Vegetarian Feast
Schedule:
1:00 pm – 3:00 pm: Cultural Performances and Lunch
3:30 – 5:30 pm: Chariot Procession on the Beach, starting at SunSplash Park
Location: SunSplash Park, 611S Atlantic Ave, Daytona Beach, FL. 32118
For more details, see our
Facebook event page
Daytona Beach Festival of Chariots location
APRIL 12, 2025 – St. Augustine Festival of Chariots
A day of cultural family fun in historic St. Augustine!
Live Music
Chariot Procession
Traditional Indian Dance
Mantra Meditation
Free Vegetarian Feast
Schedule:
9:30 – 11:00 am: Chariot Procession around St. Augustine historic downtown
11:30 am – 12:30 pm: Lunch & Cultural Performances at Plaza de la Constitución
1:00 – 3:00 pm: Mantra Music singing party on St. George Street
Location: Plaza de la Constitución, 22 King St., St. Augustine, FL
Please find parking at one of the paid lots or on the street. There is no designated event parking.
For more details, see our
Facebook event page
MAY 16-17, 2025 – Soul Light Music Fest & Festival of Chariots @ Jacksonville Beach
An epic cultural weekend at Jacksonville Beach!
Visit our Landing page for the event:
FESTIVAL INFO
May 16, 2025 – Soul Light Music Fest
May 17, 2025 – Festival of Chariots Jacksonville Beach
Location: Jacksonville Beach Seawalk Pavilion, 75 1st St N, Jacksonville Beach, FL
Would you like us to come to your hometown?
